data.title: University of Michigan Athletics
data.meta_description: Mark Estapa (94) F - Junior Year (2023-24) • B1G All-Academic Team • Scored first two goals of the season in 10-1 victory over Lindenwood (10/28) • Assisted ...
data.text:
Junior Year (2023-24)

• B1G All-Academic Team

• Scored first two goals of the season in 10-1 victory over Lindenwood (10/28)

• Assisted on one goal in OT Win vs. Minnesota (11/11)

• Recorded two goals and one assist in 7-1 victory over Stonehill (1/13)

• Tallied one assist in 4-0 victory over Notre Dame (2/23)

• Contributed one goal in 6-5 overtime win at Minnesota (3/2)

• Notched an assist in a 4-3 win over North Dakota in the NCAA regional semifinal (3/29)

Sophomore Year (2022-23)

• B1G All-Academic Team

• Played in 40 games and scored five goals and seven assists, +6 with 22 blocked shots

• Scored a goal in 7-4 opening night win over Lindenwood (10/7)

• Assisted on a goal in 9-2 victory over Boston University (10/14)

• Recorded an assist in 5-4 win vs. WMU (10/28)

• Assisted on a pair of goals in 6-3 loss vs. Minnesota (11/18)

• Tallied a goal in 4-1 win vs. Harvard (11/26)

• Scored a pair of goals in a 4-2 road victory at Wisconsin (12/3)

• Collected a pair of assists in series sweep vs. #6 PSU (1/27, 1/28)

• Picked up an assist in 3-3 tie (SO loss) at #10 Ohio State (2/16)

• Contributed a goal in 11-1 NCAA Tournament first round win vs. Colgate (3/24)

Freshman Year (2021-22)

• Recorded first career assist as a Wolverine in the 6-1 season-opening win vs. LSSU (10/8)

• Scored first career goal as a Wolverine in 6-2 win over Minnesota (12/4)

• Tallied an assist in 5-2 win at Ohio State (12/10)

• Assisted on two goals in 6-2 victory at Wisconsin (1/29)

• Picked up an assist in 6-2 win vs. MSU (2/11)

• Totaled a goal and two assists in weekend sweep over Ohio State (2/18, 2/19)

• Contributed an assist in 7-4 NCAA Tournament win vs. Quinnipiac (3/27)

• Set up Bordeleau's third period goal with an assist in Frozen Four semifinal vs. Denver (4/7)

Before Michigan

• Spent two seasons with Tri-City Storm

• Tallied 13 goals and 23 assists in 91 games

• His first career USHL goal was voted both 2020 USHL Goal and Play of the Year

• Storm was the 2021 Western Conference regular-season champion

• Five-time Michigan state champion with Little Caesers

• Alternate captain USA at the 2019-20 Hlinka Gretsky Cup and also competed at the 2018 Five Nations Tournament

• A 2020 graduate of St. Clair High School

Personal

• Born January 13, 2002

• Son of Mark Estapa and Carrie Fredal-Estapa

• Mark (Central Michigan '90) is a teacher and Carrie (Michigan State '89) is a teacher

• Has one brother, John (Michigan State '20)

• Ross School of Business
